nodes.label: Jack Kerouac
nodes.description: An American novelist and poet who was a pioneer of the Beat Generation.

nodes.label: On the Road
nodes.description: A 1957 novel by Jack Kerouac, based on the travels of Kerouac and his friends across the United States. It is a defining work of the postwar Beat and Counterculture generations.

nodes.label: Allen Ginsberg
nodes.description: An American poet and writer. Starting in the 1940s, he was a leading figure of the Beat Generation.

nodes.label: Howl
nodes.description: A poem written by Allen Ginsberg in 1955, considered to be one of the great works of American literature.

nodes.label: William S. Burroughs
nodes.description: An American writer and visual artist, widely considered a primary figure of the Beat Generation and a major postmodern author.

nodes.label: The Beat Generation
nodes.description: A literary movement started by a group of authors whose work explored and influenced American culture and politics in the post-war era.

nodes.label: Counter-culture
nodes.description: A subculture whose values and norms of behavior differ substantially from those of mainstream society.

commentary: Hit the road with the Beat Generation, a movement that redefined American literature.
